Dear Jemma,

 

Hope you are well.

 

I am writing to inquire about the status of the Director – Procurement position.

 

Following Priya’s resignation, I do not see the role posted on Chalhoub Careers, though I did see an expired listing on Gulf Careers for the position.

 

Likely I have missed it, and the position is already filled. However, if the position is still open, I would like the opportunity to discuss the possibility of assuming the role—if there is buy-in from the hiring manager on my ideas and vision for the department.

 

For context, I was part of the Procurement team for two years before transitioning back to Admin. For me, at least at the time, central procurement lacked any form of true value creation and meaningful collaboration. Even though the leadership at the time was capable and hardworking, the direction pursued was not ideal—full of friction and ultimately ineffective.

Even though the leadership at the time was capable and hardworking, the direction pursued was not ideal—full of friction and ultimately ineffective.

 

In all cases, if the position is not yet filled and there is an opportunity for internal mobility, I would like the chance to present my ideas on how the function could be evolved to truly create value in a spirit of collaboration, rather than just annoy people attempting to cut costs here and there in an attempt to justify the department’s existence.

 

To clarify, I am not looking to step away from my current role but rather to explore ways to take on additional responsibilities while possibly delegating certain aspects of my existing position as reasonably required.

 

At this point, I just want to have some information on the landscape before navigating further. I thank you for your time.

 

Best Regards,

Hagop
